comment.author: 7229750@N07
comment._content: The CO 1069-134 set has been discussed on the East_African_Steam yahoogroup, and several people are of the opinion that this series tagged as Ujiji is actually of the Magadi Soda plant in Kenya. 1°53'35" S 36°17'23" E Possibly some time in the 1920s. The two captioned as Kajiado could be correct, Kajiado is on the railway branch line to Magadi. Please see the thread at finance.groups.yahoo.com/group/East_African_Steam/message... (ygroup subscription required).

comment.author: 102524903@N04
comment._content: Given the accompanying photographs, this is undoubtedly at Magadi, Kenya, though nowadays the rail line stops at the factory, and does not go over the trona lake itself. A bit does go over the salt flats, though, such as in this picture I took close by: www.flickr.com/photos/102524903@N04/9842711194/
